item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.title: S. 1867, DHS Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems Coordinator Act
item.description: As ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs on June 19, 2019

summary.text:
DHS Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems Coordinator Act

This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to designate a senior DHS official within the Office of Strategy, Policy, and Plans as the Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) Coordinator to oversee and coordinate with relevant DHS offices and components on the development of guidance and regulations to counter threats associated with UAS (i.e., drones).

The coordinator shall serve as the principal DHS official for sharing information regarding counter-UAS technology to the private sector.

DHS Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems Coordinator Act

This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to designate a senior DHS official within the Office of Strategy, Policy, and Plans as the Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) Coordinator to oversee and coordinate with relevant DHS offices and components on the development of guidance and regulations to counter threats associated with UAS (i.e., drones).

The coordinator shall serve as the principal DHS official for sharing information regarding counter-UAS technology to the private sector.

bill.title: DHS Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems Coordinator Act

item.title: DHS Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems Coordinator Act

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to Senate
item.title: DHS Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems Coordinator Act
DHS Countering Unmanned Aircraft Systems Coordinator Act
A bill to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish in the Department of Homeland Security an Unmanned Aircraft Systems Coordinator, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 195.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
